item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Unlock Max Moves?
item.description:
Pokemon GO debuted numerous Dynamax Pokemon with the Max Battles and other related functions. Dynamax Pokemon are larger and have a red glow with red clouds over their head. These monsters have a boost in their prowess and can use Max Moves.

Pokemon GO players can get wild Dynamax Pokemon by winning against Power Spot Bosses or Max Battles. After getting a Dynamax Pokemon, you can teach it Max Moves. These moves are exclusive to Dynamax Pokemon and can level up the more you use them. But numerous other in-game elements must be collected to access these moves, and this guide details everything you need.

How To Unlock Max Moves In Pokemon GO?

Dynamax Pokemon are the only ones that can use the Max Moves. Unlike other in-game moves, you can level up the Max Moves and gain XP the more you use them. Remember that the requirement for accessing the Max Moves is a certain amount of Max Particles and Pokemon GO Candies . There are a total of 3 Max Moves that the Dynamax Pokemon can access:

  • Fast Attack-based Attack: The first Max Move your Dynamax Pokemon can access is an attack based on the specific Pokemon’s Fast Attack.
  • Max Spirit: The Max Spirit can heal the Pokemon and other monsters in your battle roster.
  • Max Guard: The Max Guard acts as the shield against the attacks of the Power Spot Bosses.

How To Get Max Particles In Pokemon GO?

The Max Particles allow monsters to transform into Dynamax Pokemon and access these Max Moves. You can get them by engaging with Power Spots, exploring the map, and purchasing from the in-game shop and Pokemon GO Web Store.

  • Interacting with Power Spots rewards 100 Max Particles for each Power Spot daily ; you’ll get 20 Max Particles for the initial visit .
  • Walking 2 KM in Pokemon GO rewards with 300 Max Particles .
  • You can purchase Max Particle packs from the in-game Store and Web Store.

Pokemon GO players can only store a specific amount of Max Particles; there is a limit on daily collection amounts. Currently, the Max Particle limit is 1,000 , with a daily cap of 800 . You must spend the Max Particle by entering Max Battles or upgrading a Dynamax Pokemon’s Max Moves to collect more Max Particles after reaching the limit.

Once you collect the required amount of Max Particles and Candies, you can unlock Max Moves in Pokemon GO . You can upgrade the Max Moves to level 2, but keep in mind that the Max Particle and Candy/Candy XL requirement is different for different Dynamax Pokemon.

item.title: 7 Polarizing Open-World Games That You Should Still Try
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • No Man's Sky offers vast exploration, solid crafting, and fun combat, making it a polarizing game that has matured. (116)
  • Watch Dogs features well-thought-out hacking mechanics but disappointed some at launch, leaving fans divided. (113)
  • Cyberpunk 2077 faced backlash for overpromising and a buggy launch, dividing players despite later improvements. (120)

Open-world games span many genres, from first-person shooters, to complex survival games. Some open-world maps are so huge that a player will likely never experience it in its entirety. Others opt for smaller open-world maps, that have been lovingly crafted, with high levels of attention to detail.

There have been a number of open-world games that have been polarizing, with the opinions of gamers split, although rarely down the middle. Some of these games went on to become beloved classics, with active communities still heavily invested in the game many years after launch, despite a rocky start or public criticism.

7 No Man's Sky

Space Exploration And Survival

Featuring a universe made up of billions of planets waiting to be explored, few games offer as much freedom as No Man’s Sky . The crafting gameplay is excellent, exploration is rewarded, and combat can be fast and furious at times, whether in space or on the ground. Overall, No Man’s Sky has matured into an exceptional title, but this wasn’t always the case.

What makes No Man’s Sky such a polarizing game, is the debacle that took place at its launch. Many of the promised features were missing, and those that were included didn’t match up to the pre-launch hype. Many players dropped the game at this stage, and refuse to go back to it, even though it is now considered something of a classic.

6 Watch Dogs

A Great Hacking Game

The gameplay in Watch Dogs takes place sometime in the future, in the city of Chicago. Players have access to a full range of hacking tools, as well as methods of surveillance and espionage. Using these tools, they strive to complete the mission-driven storyline.

The game was praised for its realistic, exciting setting, and the well-thought-out hacking mechanics. However, on launch, it was discovered that the shipped product did not live up to the pre-release hype. In short, many players loved the game, but others were left disappointed.

5 Far Cry 2

2nd Installment Of This FPS Franchise

The original Far Cry game was groundbreaking in many respects. It gave a glimpse of how gaming technology was about to enable developers to take gaming experiences to a whole new level. When Far Cry 2 was announced, fans of the original game expected more of the same, but bigger and better.

Unfortunately, Far Cry 2 launched with some new gameplay features that FPS fans simply found cumbersome and over complex. Additionally, the core gameplay was much more focused on survival, moving away from the combat-focused experience of the first game. This left players divided over their opinions of the game.

4 Assassin's Creed 3

Set During The American Revolution

The 3rd installment in the Assasin’s Creed franchise was intended to mix things up a little, and bring a more varied gaming experience to keep the franchise fresh. This included a completely new main character, and a much more modern setting than the previous 2 games. It also added new gameplayer elements such as scripted historical events.

However, the developers should have remembered the old adage, if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it. The changes to the gameplay, as well as the very different setting, didn’t go down well with much of the fanbase. So much so, that some players dropped the franchise entirely at this point and never played another Assasin’s Creed title.

3 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Huge Open World Map

Considered one of the best open-world role-playing games ever made, it may seem strange to see The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt on this list. The open-world map is exceptional, and cram-packed with content, so why is it considered a polarizing game?

Well, there are players that criticized the game for simply being too big. These players felt overwhelmed by the sheer scale of the game. Furthermore, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt touched on mature themes, which didn’t sit well with some players. This lead to the game having something of a rocky start, although it must be said that this didn’t stop it from becoming one of the most respected RPGs of all time.

2 Red Dead Redemption 2

Explore The Old West

Red Dead Redemption 2 is another surprising title to find on this list. The game is generally seen as one of the best open-world experiences ever. Whether the player wants to follow the exquisitely crafted main storyline, or simply head off to explore, few games are as immersive as Red Dead Redemption 2 .

But some players have issues with the game. Stating that its slow pace, and often tedious attention to detail leave them feeling more like they are playing a part in an interactive movie than playing a game. A further criticism is the poor way that online gameplay has been, and continues to be managed, as cheating and exploiting are rife.

1 Cyberpunk 2077

Long Awaited And Then Largely Criticized

Cyberpunk 2077 spent more than a decade in development. At first, little was divulged about the game. However, as the launch date came closer, the hype began. Marketed as something that would be one of the best games ever released to date, the reality was a half-finished title full of game-breaking bugs.

The blatant overpromising from the developers lead to very vocal criticism of the game on launch. With many players requesting refunds. Yes, Cyberpunk 2077 is now a fantastic game, with all of the problems fixed. The Phantom Liberty DLC was also well received. However, there are a whole host of players who refuse to play the title to this day because of the terrible launch.

item.title: Devas Of Creation: How To Get Free Mounts
item.description:
When playing Devas of Creation , players need to explore a fairly large map with various NPCs and enemies. However, traveling on foot takes quite a long time. And, if you do not want to spend Essence Tokens on fast travel, you should get a mount. Fortunately, there are several ways for players to get free mounts in Devas of Creation .

Mounts can greatly simplify the world exploration in this Roblox experience. In addition, with their help, it is much easier to avoid annoying low-level mobs. But, be prepared to spend quite a lot of time on getting mounts.

How To Get Free Mounts In Devas Of Creation

Beginner players may think that traveling on foot is fine. But, this is only because the first quests are located near the starting location. You should not delay getting personal transport . So, to get free mounts in Devas of Creation , you can use several methods:

  • Seasonal Pass Progression
  • Completing Side Quests

Free Mount As Seasonal Pass Rewards

The Season Pass has a large number of different rewards in Devas of Creation , among which are mounts. Of course, almost all the best goodies are in the premium tiers . But, even in the free ones, you can find worthy rewards. One of these is the Stormscale mount , which is unlocked at tier 81 of the Seasonal Pass.

Of course, getting Stormscale fast is impossible for beginners. However, since it is a Legendary mount, it is worth all the effort you will have to put in. If you want to get your first mount in Devas of Creation faster, however, you should either buy the Premium Seasonal Pass or go to the second method.

Free Mounts From Zorin's Side Quest

Following the story quests, you will, sooner or later, meet the Zorin NPC in Northwood . His side quest is quite long, as you will need to get certain items for him several times. Some of them drop from nearby mobs, while others can be purchased in the grocery store.

To start Zorin's side quest, you must be level 20 .

As a reward for completing this side quest in Devas of Creation , you will get a chest from which 3 different mounts can drop. It is worth noting that the drop rate of each of them is only 3% . But, since Zorin's side quest can be replayed , you have a chance to get each of the available free mounts:

  • Horse
  • Pig
  • Shadow Pouncer

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: 10 Best Subclass Mods, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The Toolkit Data in Patch 7 of Baldur's Gate 3 offers enhanced modding capabilities for deeper game customization.
  • New subclass mods like Nightingale, Way of the Ascendant Dragon, and The Remembrance bring unique abilities and strategies for players.
  • Subclasses like Oathbreaker, Horizon Walker, and Oathoflove provide diverse options to expand gameplay experiences in Baldur's Gate 3.

Thanks to the release of Toolkit Data alongside Patch 7 of Baldur’s Gate 3 , players and the modding community now have greater freedom to create mods, expanding the possibilities for game customization. This tool allows for the modification of deeper files, which were previously restricted, offering new ways to tailor the gaming experience and enrich the content available.

One of the most exciting uses of Toolkit Data is the ability to further customize subclasses in Baldur’s Gate 3 . This brings more complexity to character creation, enabling players to explore new combinations of skills and playstyles. Whether through Toolkit Data or traditional methods, several subclass mods rank among the best available, offering extensive personalization for an enhanced experience.

10 Nightingale

A Critical Hit-Focused Rogue Subclass

  • Main Class: Rogue
  • Mod Location: Baldur’s Gate 3 Mod Manager
  • Mod Author: zhengjan

The Nightingale subclass, introduced through mods in Patch 7 of Baldur’s Gate 3 , provides an intriguing option for players who prefer a stealthy approach with a focus on critical hits. Designed for Rogues, this subclass combines combat and support abilities, including bonuses to initiative and advantage on Perception checks, alongside proficiency with musical instruments.

Upon reaching level 5, Nightingale unlocks Shadow Form, enabling the player to deal additional damage while remaining protected. Without the need for heavy armor, critical hits become more frequent, making this subclass a strategic choice for those looking to maximize both damage and agility in combat.

9 Way Of The Ascendant Dragon

A Monk Subclass Compatible With Patch 7 Of Baldur’s Gate 3

  • Main Class: Monk
  • Mod Location: Nexus Mods
  • Mod Author: sumradagnoth8

Way of the Ascendant Dragon is a dragon-themed subclass available through Nexus Mods and compatible with Patch 7 of Baldur’s Gate 3 . Inspired by the majestic power of dragons, this subclass allows Monks to change the damage type of their attacks to draconic elements and grants temporary flight with spectral wings, enhancing mobility in combat.

With abilities such as Breath of the Dragon and Aspect of the Wyrm, the subclass offers versatility to Monks, enabling them to unleash area-of-effect elemental damage and provide resistances to allies. Originating from Fizban's Treasury of Dragons, these improvements make this subclass ideal for players seeking a unique Monk experience.

8 The Remembrance

A Subclass Focused On Dark Urge

  • Main Class: Warlock
  • Mod Location: Baldur’s Gate 3 Mod Manager
  • Mod Author: randoruda

The Remembrance subclass, available through mods introduced in Patch 7 of Baldur’s Gate 3 , is perfect for players interested in exploring the afterlife and the memories of countless lives. This mod offers a range of abilities that combine arcane knowledge with past experiences, allowing Warlocks to learn spells from different disciplines and adapt to new situations.

This subclass is especially appealing for those planning to follow the Dark Urge path, as its abilities are designed to complement that narrative. The Remembrance enhances the Warlock’s versatility, blending raw power with support and survival talents in combat scenarios.

7 Oathbreaker

A Secret Paladin Subclass Unlocked Early

  • Main Class: Paladin
  • Mod Location: Baldur’s Gate 3 Mod Manager
  • Mod Author: randoruda

While not technically a brand-new subclass, this mod allows players to select the Oathbreaker option at the start of Baldur’s Gate 3 , bypassing the in-game triggers that typically unlock it later in the story. For players unfamiliar with the Paladin class, becoming an Oathbreaker usually involves making choices that go against the Paladin’s oath, unlocking new powers and abilities.

With this mod, however, players can dive into the darker side of the Paladin class right from the beginning, adding depth and intrigue to their character's journey, while unlocking unique skills and abilities tied to breaking their sacred oath.

6 Horizon Walker

A Lore-Friendly Ranger Subclass

  • Main Class: Ranger
  • Mod Location: Nexus Mods
  • Mod Author: sumradagnoth8

Available through Nexus Mods and compatible with Patch 7 of Baldur’s Gate 3 , the Horizon Walker subclass introduces a new option for Rangers focused on defending against threats from other planes. This subclass excels at detecting portals and channeling multiversal energies into enhanced attacks, providing new strategies for taking on enemies.

In addition to boosting spellcasting and melee combat abilities, Horizon Walker offers access to spells like Misty Step and Teleportation Circle, increasing the player's mobility on the battlefield. This mod adds flexibility and agility, making it an excellent choice for Rangers looking to expand their tactical options.

5 Oathoflove

A Support-Focused Paladin Subclass

  • Main Class: Paladin
  • Mod Location: Baldur’s Gate 3 Mod Manager
  • Mod Author: vosem1

Although it isn't based on any official material published by Wizards of The Coast for Dungeons & Dragons , the Oath of Love subclass offers an intriguing option for players who want a Paladin focused on maximizing support abilities. While Paladins are generally support-oriented, this subclass further enhances their ability to aid the party.

As players progress through this modded subclass in Baldur’s Gate 3 , they will unlock abilities geared toward protecting the team and casting emotion-based spells like Charm Person. This subclass is an excellent choice for those seeking an alternative to Shadowheart as the party’s primary support character.

4 Spellblade

A New Wizard Subclass In Baldur’s Gate 3

  • Main Class: Wizard
  • Mod Location: Baldur’s Gate 3 Mod Manager
  • Mod Author: zhengjan

While the Warlock class already offers players access to melee combat without sacrificing spellcasting, the Spellblade mod provides a fresh take on the concept. Introduced with Patch 7 of Baldur’s Gate 3 , this mod allows Wizards to combine their magical prowess with melee weaponry, creating a hybrid class.

The Spellblade subclass, which can be selected starting at level two, gives players the chance to use melee weapons while benefiting from the full array of Wizard spells. However, it's worth noting that Wizards remain fragile, so careful spell selection is crucial to balancing offensive and defensive capabilities.

3 Samurai

A Fighter Subclass With Eastern Influence

  • Main Class: Fighter
  • Mod Location: Nexus Mods
  • Mod Author: sumradagnoth8

The Samurai subclass, a favorite among players who enjoy Eastern-inspired combat, has been brought to Baldur’s Gate 3 through mods. Based on the version from Xanathar’s Guide to Everything, this subclass is perfect for players seeking a combat style rooted in unwavering determination.

The Samurai subclass provides additional proficiency in skills such as Persuasion and Insight and unlocks Fighting Spirit, which grants advantage on attacks and temporary hit points. This mod offers a solid choice for players looking to combine combat efficiency with a stoic, disciplined fighting style.

2 WarlockCelestial

A Support-Oriented Subclass

  • Main Class: Warlock
  • Mod Location: Baldur’s Gate 3 Mod Manager
  • Mod Author: tepkunset

The Warlock class in Baldur’s Gate 3 is among the most enjoyable to play, especially when a well-thought-out build transforms it into a machine capable of firing off Eldritch Blasts at enemies. However, the class is usually more focused on offensive roles within the party.

For players who want to stick with the Warlock class but adopt a more supportive role without sacrificing attacks, the Warlock Celestial mod is an excellent choice. This subclass adds an extra option, inspired by the Celestial from Xanathar's Guide to Everything for Dungeons & Dragons 5e , allowing for a balanced support role with offensive capabilities.

1 Path Of The Zealot

A Divine Barbarian Subclass

  • Main Class: Barbarian
  • Mod Location: Nexus Mods
  • Mod Author: sumradagnoth8

Clerics, Paladins, and Druids aren't the only classes capable of channeling divine power in Baldur’s Gate 3 . Thanks to the Path of the Zealot mod, Barbarians can now harness divine energy, making their moments of rage even more devastating.

In addition to dealing devastating damage, Path of the Zealot offers divine protection abilities, such as rerolling failed saving throws and inspiring allies with a battle cry. This subclass is perfect for players looking to explore new approaches to the Barbarian class, combining raw power with divine intervention for an exciting gameplay experience.

item.title: Resident Evil 4 Remake: Best Exclusive Upgrades, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Exclusive Upgrades in Resident Evil 4 give weapons unique abilities, like increased firepower or unlimited ammo.
  • Players must fully upgrade weapons to unlock Exclusive Upgrades, which can be costly.
  • Specific weapons like the LE5, SG-09 R, and Riot Gun benefit greatly from their Exclusive Upgrades, enhancing power and performance.

In the Resident Evil 4 remake, Exclusive Upgrades represent the ultimate enhancements for weapons, granting them unique abilities. These abilities come in six types: increased firepower, additional ammo capacity, boosted critical hit rate, enhanced penetration, faster rate of fire or attack speed, and unlimited ammo or indestructibility.

Two key factors make it difficult for players to decide which Exclusive Upgrades to invest in:

  1. Unlock Requirement : Exclusive Upgrades only become available once a weapon is fully upgraded.
  2. Cost : These upgrades are expensive, ranging from 10,000 to 100,000 pesetas.

Before diving into the best Exclusive Upgrades in the Resident Evil 4 remake , here's a table summarizing all the available enhancements:

Weapon

Exclusive Upgrade

Punisher

5x Penetration

Blacktail

1.5x Firepower

W-870

2x Firepower

Skull Shaker

2x Firepower

Riot Gun

1.5x Firepower

SR M1903

2x Firepower

Stingray

2X Rate of Fire

Broken Butterfly

1.5x Firepower

Handcannon

Unlimited Ammo

TMP

1.5x Firepower

Chicago Sweeper

Unlimited Ammo

Bolt Thrower

2x Ammo Capacities

Combat Knife

1.5x Attack Speed

Primal knife

Indestructibility

Fighting Knife

2x Power

Matilda

2x Ammo Capacity

Striker

2x Ammo Capacity

LE5

5x Penetration

CQBR

1.5x Firepower

Killer7

5x Critical Hit Rate

SG-09 R

5x Critical Hit Rate

Red9

1.5x Firepower

Sentinel Nine

5x Critical Hit Rate

7 LE5

Exclusive Upgrade: Penetrate Through Five Targets

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 255,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 80,000

SMGs have historically struggled against Resident Evil 4's enemies due to their subpar firepower. However, the LE5 stands out from its counterparts primarily because of its effectiveness against Regeneradors. With its Exclusive Upgrade, which boosts its penetration power by five times, the LE5 becomes a formidable weapon that no group of Regeneradors can withstand.

Players should equip the LE5 with the Biosensor Scope to optimize it for Regenerador hunting. But even without this attachment, a fully upgraded LE5 with enhanced penetration is invaluable. Its bullets can pierce shields and hit enemies lined up, offering crowd-control capabilities on par with a powerful shotgun.

6 SG-09 R

Exclusive Upgrade: Increase Critical Hit Rate by 5x

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 224,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 80,000

A fivefold increase in critical hit rate might not seem like an enticing upgrade for a handgun like the SG-09 R at first. However, this subtle enhancement elevates the gunplay significantly, making it well worth the investment. Firing the Silver Ghost with its Exclusive Upgrade delivers a deeply satisfying experience, especially with the frequent headshot bursts players can land.

While the SG-09 R isn't the most powerful handgun in the Resident Evil 4 remake, some may question its long-term value. But when used for high-accuracy shooting, with a focus on landing headshots rather than sheer damage, the SG-09 R can surpass even the Red9 in effectiveness.

5 Riot Gun

Exclusive Upgrade: Increase Firepower by 1.5x

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 320,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 80,000

The Riot Gun has earned its reputation as the best shotgun in the Resident Evil 4 remake for two key reasons: its high knockback power and above-average firepower. When fully upgraded to level five, it boasts 12.8 firepower, making it the second-strongest shotgun. However, its Exclusive Upgrade boosts this to 19.2, making it the most powerful shotgun in the game, with the Striker trailing at 16.2 firepower.

Investing in the Riot Gun is well worth it, not only because of its strength but also due to the sheer enjoyment it offers. The sound, the knockback, and the way it dismantles enemies provide a pure rush of adrenaline.

4 SR M1903

Exclusive Upgrade: Increase Firepower by 2x

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 247,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 100,000

Veteran players instinctively recognize the SR M1903's potential to become the most powerful rifle in the Resident Evil 4 remake. Its primary drawback is its bolt-action mechanism, requiring the player to manually chamber each round after firing. However, this limitation is offset by its immense firepower, making the SR M1903 the deadliest rifle in the game. With its Exclusive Upgrade, the SR M1903 reaches a staggering 10.6 power, the highest among all rifles.

In comparison, the fully upgraded SR M1903 far surpasses the game's two prominent assault rifles: the Stingray maxes out at 4.9 per shot, while the CQBR reaches 5.1. This substantial power difference makes the SR M1903 the ideal choice for players who seek the satisfaction of one-shot sniper kills.

3 Red9

Exclusive Upgrade: Increase Firepower by 2x

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 284,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 100,000

The Red9 was nerfed in the Resident Evil 4 remake, with its maximum firepower reduced to 4.05 from the original 5.00—far below the 6.5 it reached in some earlier versions. Despite this reduction, the Red9 remains the most powerful handgun in the game, even without its Exclusive Upgrade. At level five, its firepower sits at 2.7, a level unmatched by any other handgun. However, the Exclusive Upgrade's 1.5x power boost transforms it into a true skull crusher.

Aside from its power, the Red9 is a stylish handgun that can be paired with a wooden stock, giving Leon a distinctive shooting stance. Even better, players can acquire this unique weapon for free in Chapter Four after defeating the lake monster, Del Lago.

2 Handcannon

Exclusive Upgrade: Give This Gun Unlimited Ammo

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 530,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 10,000

The Handcannon is a bonus weapon that many players might not access during their first playthrough, but once unlocked, it opens the door to a whole new gameplay experience: speedrunning the Resident Evil 4 remake. Its Exclusive Upgrade—granting infinite ammo—allows players to decimate any enemy type with just one or two shots, making it possible to complete the campaign in mere hours.

What makes the Handcannon truly worthy of using Exclusive Upgrade tickets is its overwhelming firepower. With a staggering 36.00 firepower, it's essentially a pocket-sized rocket launcher capable of downing the toughest bosses in seconds. Now, imagine combining this devastating magnum with infinite ammo—it's a weapon that strikes terror into the hearts of the Ganados.

1 Primal Knife

Exclusive Upgrade: Make This Knife Indestructible

  • Full Upgrade Cost : 250,000
  • Exclusive Upgrade Cost : 10,000

In the Resident Evil 4 remake, the best Exclusive Upgrade is the Primal Knife's indestructibility. This enhancement ensures the knife never breaks, giving players unlimited parries and stealth attacks.

The repair mechanic is a new feature in the remake, adding a lifespan to melee weapons (and the bulletproof vest). Each time a blade breaks or the vest becomes unusable, players must pay the Merchant a repair fee. However, with the Primal Knife's Exclusive Upgrade, players gain an unbreakable weapon, eliminating the need for maintenance and providing immunity against all incoming melee attacks. (No more dying to the Chainsaw Man.)

Players can unlock the Primal Knife by completing the Revolution Wind-Up Challenge. It involves breaking 16 clockwork castellans scattered across the RE4 remake ’s map .
